text:
75-year-old woman with history of hypertension and multiple myeloma
   presents to ICU with tachycardia to 180s this AM in setting of multiple
   refractory episodes of atrial fibrillation with RVR earlier in hospital
   course.
   Altered mental status (not Delirium)
   Assessment:
   Pt with labile MS, per 7F report patient has been nonverbal for several
   days due to mucosal irritation; MS has been progressively worsening, on
   assessment patient sedated on fentanyl/versed. Arousable to stimuli
   with periods of increased alertness. Appears uncomfortable w/mouth care
   and general care.  Does not follow commands.
   Action:
   Reoriented frequently, requires additional boluses of fentanyl/versed
   w/mouth care and/or general care.
   Response:
   Ongoing
   Plan:
   Continue to reorient frequently, wean sedation as tolerated.
   Respiratory failure
   Assessment:
   Received patient intubated and vented. Patient vented on PSV 40% 14/5,
   on assessment breath sounds clear diminished at the bases. Unlabored
   breathing.  Thick bloody secretions suctioned orally and via ETT.
   Action:
   Continue w/mechanical ventilation, VAP precautions, mouth care q4hr and
   PRN. [**3-9**] severe mucositis mouth care done w/[**First Name9 (NamePattern2) 12360**]
   [**Male First Name (un) **]/nystatin/lidocaine (q2hr)
   Response:
   ongoing
   Plan:
   Continue to monitor patient resp status, f/u AM CXR, wean off vent as
   tolerated.
   Atrial fibrillation (Afib)
   Assessment:
   Received patient in Afib at 80-110
s, b/p 100-140
s. On diltiazem q6hr
   and lopressor [**Hospital1 7**]. On assessment peripheral pulses present. Mild
   general edema.
   Action:
   Telemetry, meds ASDIR, control pain and agitation.
   Response:
   Pt continues to have increased HR with fevers, agitation/mouth
   care/general care.
   Plan:
   Continue to monitor patient hemodynamic status, continue to rate
   control
   Multiple myeloma  (Cancer, Malignant Neoplasm)
   Assessment:
   Patient is SCT day +11. Tmax 100.6 ax. Pan cultured again yesterday
   Action:
   Monitor counts, trend temp. ABX ASDIR, f/u cultures, Tylenol.
   Response:
   Plan:
   Continue to monitor patient
s counts, f/u cx data, abx ASDIR. Transfuse
   as needed
   GI: abd soft slightly distended positive for hypoactive BS, loose stool
   via rectal bag. OGT with TF at goal
 tolerates well, no residuals.
   GU: yellow urine with sediment via Foley.
   IV access: 3 PIV
 patent, TLC pulled yesterday and sent for culture.
